In Old Kentucky: a Play in Four Acts

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: In Old Kentucky: a Play in Four Acts 1893
did.abstract: Bound autograph manuscript written in ink, in the vernacular. The play is about a Kentucky mountain girl who wins the heart of a young aristocrat by racing a horse.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: In Old Kentucky: a Play in Four Acts (MS 021). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Inscription inside the manuscript states: "The play, In Old Kentucky, was written by Charles T. Dazey ... It was produced by Jacob [Lett] and was performed on the regular stage for 27 consecutive seasons..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Bound autograph manuscript written in ink, in the vernacular. The play is about a Kentucky mountain girl who wins the heart of a young aristocrat by racing a horse. A note on the title page indicates that the manuscript is "corrected and amended by the author."

relatedmaterial.p: Microfiche 358 at the University of Arizona Library is the prompt book for this play; the original typescript is located in the New York Public Library.
